snippet: As the Supreme Court reviews a section of the landmark Voting Rights Act, arguments for and against election monitoring are again being batted about in New York.
abstract: Arguments for and against election monitoring are again being batted about in New York City as Supreme Court reviews section of landmark Voting Rights Act; narrow mandate to monitor elections in six Southern states has grown quietly, and now extends to unexpected locations, including the Bronx, where charges of gerrymandering districts remain common, and racism is difficult to recognize.

byline.contributor: Susan C. Beachy, Jack Begg and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: As the Supreme Court reviews a section of the landmark Voting Rights Act, arguments for and against election monitoring are again being batted about in New York.

headline.seo: Calls to End Voting Rights Act Stir Debate in the Bronx
headline.main: Bronx Offers Case Study Over Future of Voting Act
headline.print_headline: Bronx Offers Case Study Over Future Of Voting Act
